        buildSite
      • buildSite(contentDir, outputDir, cacheDir: string; perPage: int; force = false)

blg - Blog Generator Static site generator using markdown files and symlinks for tags.

Contributing

This project uses tight vibecoding: AI-generated code evolved granularly through human testing and interaction. Requirements emerged iteratively.

Architecture

blg favors filesystem primitives over configuration:

  • Symlinks as tags - No database, no YAML frontmatter, just ln -s
  • Directories as structure - Tag subdirectories, menu.list for ordering
  • Environment for config - .env files, env vars, CLI flags (in that precedence)

Files are content, directories are organization.

Pipeline

md/*.md â†’ [parse date] â†’ [render markdown] â†’ cache/*.html â†’ [apply template] â†’ public/*.html
       â†˜ md/tag-name/*.md (symlinks) â†’ tag pages

Incremental builds compare mtimes. Force rebuild with -f.

Modules

  • blg - CLI entry, site builder, menu logic
  • blg/types - Core data types: SourceFile, MenuItem, TagInfo
  • blg/md - Markdown parsing via margrave
  • blg/renderer - HTML generation, caching, link processing
  • blg/datetime - Date formatting with presets
  • blg/dynload - Runtime template override loading
  • blg/daemon - inotify file watcher (Linux only)

Template System

Templates use Nim source filters (.nimf). They compile to native code, not runtime interpretation.

Built-in templates:

  • helpers.nimf - Menu items, head, nav, header, footer
  • page.nimf - Static pages (no date/tags)
  • post.nimf - Blog posts (with date and tags)
  • list.nimf - Paginated post listings

Overridable procs (export with {.exportc, dynlib.}):

proc renderMenuItem*(item: MenuItem): string {.exportc, dynlib.}
proc renderHead*(fullTitle: string, config: SiteConfig): string {.exportc, dynlib.}
proc renderTopNav*(topMenu: seq[MenuItem]): string {.exportc, dynlib.}
proc renderSiteHeader*(config: SiteConfig): string {.exportc, dynlib.}
proc renderFooter*(bottomMenu: seq[MenuItem], hasMultipleMenus: bool): string {.exportc, dynlib.}

Compile and install:

nim c --app:lib -o:cache/libtemplate.so template.nim

Dependencies

  • margrave - Pure Nim markdown parser
  • std/dynlib - Template hot-loading
  • inotify - Daemon mode (Linux)

Imports

blg/renderer, blg/types, blg/dynload, blg/datetime, blg/md, blg/daemon

Procs

               force = false) {....raises: [ValueError, IOError, OSError,
    Exception, KeyError, TimeFormatParseError], tags: [ReadDirEffect,
    WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, TimeEffect, WriteDirEffect, RootEffect],
                                forbids: [].}
Main build: discover files, render changed content, write HTML.
